intro: Chloranthus tianmushanensis, commonly known as the Tianmushan chloranthus, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the Tianmushan Mountains in China. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within its limited geographic range. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
